title: How to Design a Circus‐Themed Nursery

steps.headline: Choose bright, playful colors.
steps.description: Ideally, a circus theme should use brighter colors. Circuses are often bright, playful environments. When designing a circus-themed nursery, opt for bright colors. Bright pinks, reds, greens, and yellows work great for a nursery color scheme. Feel free to mix and match colors as well, as circuses make use of patterns like stripes and polka dots. For example, use red and yellow polka-dotted wallpaper. As an alternative, use subtle, neutral colors and accent the room with bright, circus-like accessories.

steps.headline: Add murals.
steps.description: Murals can be a great touch for any nursery. Instead of using a solid color or wallpaper for one wall, paint a mural or hire someone to paint one. You can paint scenes from a circus such as clowns, animals doing tricks, tightrope walkers, and more. Be sure to choose a mural that you’ll want to keep for several years, as you’ll have to paint over it if you want to change the look of the room. Keep furniture in mind when painting a mural. Opt to paint a mural on a wall that will not have a lot of furniture surrounding it.

steps.headline: Mix and match different patterns.
steps.description: Circus themes can be somewhat chaotic. Instead of choosing a single type of pattern to dominate the room, mix and match patterns to add to the spontaneous circus atmosphere. Using patterns that are too uniform or consistent can interfere with the circus theme. For example, add a striped rug to the floor and use polka-dots for the wall paper. You can use patterns for things like furniture. Instead of a solid-colored dresser, get a dresser with vibrant patterns. You could also decide to use solid-colored furniture and paint, then add patterned accents, like lamp shades and blankets. This will keep the room from looking too busy.

steps.headline: Use stuffed animals as decorations.
steps.description: Invest in a variety of stuffed animals in the shape of circus animals. For instance, put a large stuffed giraffe standing over the crib and place elephants, lions, and tigers on bookshelves and mantels. As your baby grows, they'll be old enough to play with the stuffed toys. In addition to having decorations, you will have toys for your baby in the future. You can try creating a scene with stuffed animals. For example, you can invest in a circular piece of styrofoam or wood at a craft store and hang it from the ceiling. Place a stuffed tiger through the circle so it looks like it's jumping through a hoop. Always avoid putting stuffed animals in the crib, as this is a safety hazard. There shouldn’t be any items in the crib while the baby is in it.

steps.headline: Add circus-themed paintings.
steps.description: Buy some paintings online or at a local art store that incorporate a circus theme. These can be paintings of circus animals, like elephants, scenes from circuses, or paintings of entertainers such as clowns. Hang these up around the nursery to give it a circus feel. Some baby stores may actually sell circus prints for nurseries. If you're shopping for things like cribs and changing tables, look through the decoration aisle for circus-themed prints.

steps.headline: Place clown noses in a glass jar.
steps.description: Take a large glass jar and purchase some clown noses. You can buy these online or at some craft stores. Fill the jar with the noses and put it on display to give off a circus feel. For an added touch, opt for a jar with a red lid to match the noses.

steps.headline: Add a ticket pillow to the bed.
steps.description: Buy a pillow that's a rectangle shape and designed to look like a ticket with the words "Admit One" written on it. You can buy such pillows online, particularly on websites like Etsy. Place this in your baby's crib to add to the circus vibe. Make sure to check that the pillow is baby safe before adding it to the crib. You could also put a shadow box on the wall filled with paper circus tickets.

parts.name: Incorporating the Circus Design into Practical Items

steps.headline: Add a canopy top to the crib.
steps.description: A canopy top looks like a tent. This is a great way to make your child's nursery look like a circus. Purchase a canopy top and place it over the baby's crib. For an added circus effect, pick a canopy with a circus-like design or color. A bright, vibrant color, like a bright red, or something like stripes or polka dots will give off a circus feel.

steps.headline: Use a circus-themed mobile.
steps.description: Mobiles come in all kinds of designs, so find one that made with a circus theme. A quick internet search for something like "circus-themed mobile" should yield plenty of results. Circus mobiles may have bright circus colors and include circus animals or things like clowns.

steps.headline: Buy a circus crib.
steps.description: Some cribs are made to look like carts used to transport animals in circuses. They have circus-like bars on the side and decorative wheels attached at the bottom. A circus crib can really emphasize the circus theme, especially when paired with a canopy top. If you don't want to purchase a circus-themed crib, simply cut out large circles and draw designs on them to look like wheels. Attach them to the bottom of the crib using glue to create the circus train effect. Alternatively, paint an existing crib with red and white stripes, or paint it to look like an animal cage.

steps.headline: Select animal lamps.
steps.description: Many lamps, especially those sold at baby supply stores, are designed to look like animals. There may be a lamp with a horse as a base, for example, or a lamp where the bulb is held up by an elephant's trunk. These work great to light a circus-themed nursery. To imitate the inside of a circus arena, hang string lights across the ceiling. You could also install vintage light boxes on the walls.
